intro: Phragmanthera exellii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically features rosettes of fleshy, dark green leaves with a waxy texture. It produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with a distinctive yellow or orange center. Phragmanthera exellii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
